title: About

This page is still being built. I haven’t decided what I want to do with it, so stay tuned.
In the meantime here is me with my aunt’s parakeet Mycha1.

title: juliam98
text:
Hi, I’m Julia and this is my page.
Hope you enjoy.



This is not me, but it’s one of my favourite memes

title: About
text:
I’m Julia.
I’m 26 years old. I’m a PhD student at King’s College London. My PhD project is about synaptic connectivity and glutamatergic function in shizophrenia.
I enjoy challenges and learning new things. I constantly get excited by new projects and so I end up being mediocre in a wide range of skills, but I prefer it this way as this is my attempt to eat all the figs.
I enjoy sailing

title: About
text:
About my PhD
My PhD project is about synaptic connectivity and glutamatergic function in shizophrenia.

title: About
text:
About my coding
My coding journey started alongside my experiences with neuroimaging research; I learned Matlab to conduct EEG experiments and analyse EEG data. I started learning python too, since it has wide range of applications, even though I was not convinced by the array indexing starting at 0 (I’m still not convinced).
I learned R for statistical analyses, because I was absolutely fed up with SPSS, and I did not know Julia existed yet. The ever shifting figures in the word format of my undergraduate thesis pushed me to learn LaTeX. I learnt the basics of HTML and CSS when I started working on this website.
During my MSc and PhD I learnt bash scripting, which I think is so much fun.
This is pretty much all I know- bits of many languages, but most at a very very basic level.
